JEdPoint
Class JEdPointModule

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--JEdPoint.JEdPointModule
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public abstract class JEdPointModule
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable

Base class which all modules extend.

Handles message sending and processing, the latter of which is abstract and needs to be written by the developer.

The two important parts of this module class is message sending and message processing.

Message Sending
There are various ways of sending messages, depending on what one's needs are.
First, there's the Send now - Receive now method, which is what sendMessage() does.
Second, there's the Send now - Receive later method, which is what queueMessage() does.

Message Processing When a module receives a message, it should be processed. Processing is done by:

  • Extracting the message type from the message object.
  • Handling the message
  • Returning the message
Preferrably, the following piece of example code illustrated how processMessage should be implemented... 
   private JEdPointMessage processMessage(int messageType, JEdPointMessage JPM) throws JEdPointException
   {
     switch (messageType)
     {
        case JEdPointMessage.moduleInit:
        break;
        case JEdPointMessage.moduleGetInformation:
          JPM.setResponse("author", this.infoAuthor);
          JPM.setResponse("modulename", this.infoModuleName);
          JPM.setResponse("modulenameversion", this.infoModuleNameVersion);
          JPM.setResponse("shortdescription", this.infoShortDescription);
          JPM.setResponse("longdescription", this.infoLongDescription);
          JPM.setResponse("type", this.infoType);
          JPM.setResponse("versionhigh", this.infoVersionHigh);
          JPM.setResponse("versionlow", this.infoVersionLow);
          JPM.setResponse("apiversion", this.infoApiVersion);
        break;
     }
     return JPM;
   }


Note: Queue methods are untested.

sendMessage

public final JEdPoint.JEdPointMessage sendMessage(int moduleToSendTo,
                                                  int messageType,
                                                  JEdPoint.JEdPointMessage JPM)
Sends the message to the MK. Control will not be returned until the message itself is returned. The answer message will be the value returned by this method.

sendMessage

public final JEdPoint.JEdPointMessage sendMessage(int moduleToSendTo,
                                                  int messageType,
                                                  java.lang.String newKey,
                                                  java.lang.Object newValue)
Sends the message to the MK. Control will not be returned until the message itself is returned. The answer message will be the value returned by this method. This method prepares a message with a key+value pair in the request before sending it away

sendMessage

public final JEdPoint.JEdPointMessage sendMessage(int moduleToSendTo,
                                                  int messageType,
                                                  java.lang.String newKey1,
                                                  java.lang.Object newValue1,
                                                  java.lang.String newKey2,
                                                  java.lang.Object newValue2)
Sends the message to the MK. Control will not be returned until the message itself is returned. The answer message will be the value returned by this method. This method prepares a message with two key+value pairs in the request before sending it away

queueMessage

public final void queueMessage(int moduleToSendTo,
                               int messageType,
                               JEdPoint.JEdPointMessage JPM)
Queues the message for the MK. Control will be returned as soon as the message is queued. The response to this message (if there is one) will be received and processed (processMessage) by this module. Adds two keys to the message, "moduleToSendTo" and "messageType", but these are removed by JEdPoint before being routed to the destination module.

messagesAvailable

public final int messagesAvailable()
Internal method to check for available messages

Internal method to fetch and remove the first message from the queue

setJEdPointClass

public final void setJEdPointClass(JEdPoint.JEdPointMicrokernel newjp)
Internal method setting the jp variable to newjp. This is called by Jedpoint so that the module can call the main JEdPoint class when necessary
